utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How may I help you?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hi there, umm, so I've had this runny nose for the past five days and it doesn't seem to be going away so I thought I should get some help.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and ah, with the runny nose, could you describe the discharge?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it's, it's pretty clear.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any nasal obstruction or feeling as though like one of your nostrils is plugged when you're breathing in?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh yeah, I have that feeling.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you had any pain on your face?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Pain? Ah no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about a change to your sense of smell? Like loss of smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't had that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Have you had any discharge from your eyes or eye redness or any eye pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, have you had a sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, no sore throat.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you had a cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Have you had any headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Ah, just a slight headache.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, I mean, have you experienced headaches like this in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, usually when I get sick, I get get a headache.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK, can you describe where you feel the headache the most and is it pulsating or kind of always there?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's kind of always there and it's just on the sides of my head.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you tried anything for it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just some Tylenol, which seems to have helped.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uhm, and umm, yeah, have you had a cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Ah no cough like now, uhm, I I did have a slight cough last week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and it went away?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Mhmm.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Was it dry or did you were bringing up any sputum or phlegm?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, it's pretty dry.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uhm, and do you have a sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any wheezing or shortness of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How about any we, sorry, fainting or dizziness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you had any heart palpitations or feeling like your heart's racing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uhm, and have you had any abdominal pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, I have had some, like diarrhea so I think part like my stomach hurt a little bit during that time, but I don't have that anymore.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, when did you have diarrhea?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Last week as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uh, was there any blood in the stool?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you had any changes to your urinary habits? Like any pain or frequency?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and have you had any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How about any fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you had any night sweats?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see, OK. And have you had any weight loss recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, have you had any rashes or skin rashes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And how about any muscle aches or or body pains?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright and how has your energy been? Have you had fatigue?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, a little bit.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, little fatigue and and how has your appetite been?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Appetite's been OK, I'm still eating.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright. And, uhm have you been diagnosed with any medical conditions before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, I've been pretty healthy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, great and so do you take any medications regularly, either over the counter or prescribed?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you have any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and any recent hospitalizations in the past or any prior surgeries?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no. Actually, I had my appendix taken out when I was younger, but that was a long time ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, I see. And are you living, ah, can you tell me about where you're living now and who you're living with?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I'm I'm living by myself. I'm a student. I live in an apartment.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are you going to classes in person right now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, they're all online.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have, have you been around anybody who's been sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that I can think of.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you traveled anywhere recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And you smoke cigarettes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And do you smoke cannabis or use any cannabis products?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Occasionally, I will.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how often?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm I will maybe smoke once a week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uh, and use any recreational drugs like cocaine or opioids?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh gosh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh yeah, occasionally.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how many drinks would you say you have per week?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, I'll have like a bottle of wine a week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are there any heart or lung conditions that run in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. How about any cancers?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think like colon cancer runs in the family.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, umm and alright so that was everything that I think I wanted to ask about on that on the history today. I was wondering if there was anything else that you wanted to mention that I maybe forgot to ask about?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing else I I I was just wondering what I could do to feel better or make this go away.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, certainly. So, I, so it's sounds like you have the common cold or a viral illness, which it could be caused by something like adenovirus or there are others as well. However, the symptoms do overlap with COVID. As you can be like nonspecific symptoms, such as having kind of just like a runny nose like you do here, and so we will do a COVID swab and we'll await those results, but in the meantime it's mostly supportive care, so it means just trying to stay hydrated, stay rested. And just monitor your symptoms because if things do get worse, it'll be important to, uh, go to the emergency room.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, so we'll get the swab now and get that testing started.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK, that sounds great, thank you.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
